definitions: To tie up or bind tightly.
To support (a roof, bridge, or other structure) with a truss or trusses.
To prepare (a fowl, such as a chicken or turkey) for cooking by tying its wings and legs to its body.
examples: The chef will truss the chicken before roasting.
They had to truss the prisoner's hands.
The engineers designed a way to truss the old bridge.
